Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Sviceucin (natural AMPs; lactam;  class 1 lasso peptides; XXJ; 2S=S, UCSB1a; bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows poor sequence similarity (52.2%) tosiamycin.Chemical modification:  S-S bonds: C1-C13 and C7-C19.Activity: Sviceucin showed moderate activity against Gram+ bacteria BUT NOT Gram- bacteria or fungi. Most sensitive strains include B. megaterium, L. bulgaricus 340, S. aureus ATCC 6538, L. sakei subsp. sakei DSM 20017, and a closely related Streptomyces sp. 523 (MIC 1.25-2.5 uM).Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the lipid II bound 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated Jan2017.
Literature Information.Author: Li Y, Ducasse R, Zirah S, Blond A, Goulard C, Lescop E, Giraud C, Hartke A, Guittet E, Pernodet JL, Rebuffat S.2015
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of Sviceucin from Streptomyces Provides Insight into Enzyme Exchangeability and Disulfide Bond Formation in Lasso Peptides
